qas.question: How long did it take for Sevastopol to fall?
Who wanted peace when they feared of being invaded from the west?
What was the name of the treaty that ended the war?
When was the Treaty of Paris signed?
Who regained control of the Christian churches after the war was over?

context: Sevastopol fell after <a0_0>eleven months<a0_0/>, and formerly neutral countries began to join the allied cause. Isolated and facing a bleak prospect of invasion from the west if the war continued, <a1_0>Russia<a1_0/> sued for peace in March 1856. This was welcomed by France and the UK, where the citizens began to turn against their governments as the war dragged on. The war was officially ended by the <a2_0>Treaty of Paris<a2_0/>, signed on <a3_0>30 March 1856<a3_0/>. Russia lost the war, and was forbidden from hosting warships in the Black Sea. The Ottoman vassal states of Wallachia and Moldavia became largely independent. Christians were granted a degree of official equality, and the <a4_0>Orthodox church<a4_0/> regained control of the Christian churches in dispute.:415
